result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian Duran Watson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adrian Duran Watson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Adrian Duran Watson.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adrian Duran Watson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Confernence held.  Defense counsel still needs discovery and offer from the state.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with F.S.A
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Adrian Duran Watson
Current: 6173 N 39th Street, Mileaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 07-26-2022)
Prior: 4307 West Douglas Avenue, Mileaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Adrian Duran Watson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Adrian Duran Watson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case retabbed to DV intake judge of the week.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
